core.planner
Class Decomposition

java.lang.Object
  core.planner.Decomposition
All Implemented Interfaces:
Standardizable, Substituable, java.lang.Cloneable
public final class Decomposition
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, Substituable, Standardizable

The Decomposition class implements a decomposition of method. A Decomposition has the form: (C T). C (ifPart) is a conjunction and T (thenPart) is a list of tasks.

Constructor Summary
Decomposition()
          Create an empty Decomposition.

isFirst

public boolean isFirst()
Returns if this Decomposition is a first Decomposition. That means if this Decomposition must be first explored by the Planner algorithm.

Returns:
true if this Decomposition is first, false otherwise.

applySubstitution

public java.lang.Object applySubstitution(Substitution alpha,
                                          boolean replaceVar)
                                   throws SubstitutionException
Returns a new Decomposition such that the variables appearing in the Substitution are replaced with the corresponding Term of the Susbstitution.

Specified by:
applySubstitution in interface Substituable
Parameters:
alpha - the Substitution to apply.
replaceVar - flag to indicate if the Substitution allows to instantiate Variable s not in the Substitution by a Constant with the Variable name.
Returns:
a substituted copy of the Literal.
Throws:
SubstitutionException - if an error occur during substitution.
